paramInformation.label: Overload Protection
paramInformation.description: Smart plug keep detecting the load power, once the ac current exceeds 11.5a for more than 5s, smart plug's relay will turn off

paramInformation.label: Device State After Power On
paramInformation.description: Defines the state of the plug when the power is turned on

options.label: The smart plug will remain in the same state as it was before the power off
The smart plug is turned on by default
The smart plug is turned off by default

paramInformation.label: Send Reports When Load Status Changes
paramInformation.description: Defines whether to send report to the associated device (lifeline group) when the load status of the smart plug changes

options.label: Send basic report only when load condition is not changed by Z-Wave command

paramInformation.label: The State of Indicator Light
paramInformation.description: Define the corresponding state of the indicator light when the load changes

options.label: The indicator light remains the same as the load on/off status. when the load is on, the light is on. when the load is off, the light is off
Within 5 seconds after the operation load, the indicator light is consistent with the load on/off status, and then the indicator turns off

paramInformation.label: Threshold of Power Report
paramInformation.description: Set the power threshold. when the load power value exceeds this threshold, the smart plug will send a power report to the associated device (lifeline group)

paramInformation.label: Percentage Threshold For Power Reporting
paramInformation.description: Set the power percentage threshold. when the load power percentage value exceeds this threshold, the smart plug will send a power report to the associated device (lifeline group)

paramInformation.label: Frequency of Power Reports
paramInformation.description: Defines how often power reports are sent to associated devices (lifeline group)

paramInformation.label: Frequency of Energy Reports
paramInformation.description: Defines how often energy reports are sent to associated devices (lifeline group)

paramInformation.label: Frequency of Voltage Reports
paramInformation.description: Defines how often voltage reports are sent to associated devices (lifeline group)

paramInformation.label: Frequency of Electric Current Reports
paramInformation.description: Defines how often electric current reports are sent to associated devices (lifeline group)

paramInformation.label: Enable/Disable The Configuration Command
paramInformation.description: Enable:the values of other parameters can be changed. disable:the values of other parameters cannot be changed

metadata.inclusion:
Add for inclusion (non-security and security):
1)Connect the power supply.
2)Set the Z-Wave™ network main controller into learning mode.
3)Triple click the Z-button, the LED indicator will be flashing 3 times in Blue.
4)Smart Plug should be recognized and included into the Z-Wave™ network
metadata.exclusion:
1) Insert the Plug into a socket.
2) Set the Z-Wave™ network controller into the exclusion mode. 
3) Triple click the Z button.
4) LED will blink in blue for 3 times, and then start slow flashing to indicate that the remove for exclusion is successful. LED will indicate network status after it is removed from Z-Wave™ network
metadata.reset:
Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable.
Long press the button for 20 seconds and the blue LED will speed up the flash and then LED will keep on for 3 seconds in blue and Smart Plug will send ”Device Reset Locally Notification” to the main controller and exclude from the Z-Wave™ network, this procedure will reset Smart Plug to factory default. Please use this procedure only when the network primary controller is missing or otherwise inoperable
